titles.title: To require that in a notice of proposed rule making for a new rule, the notice shall identify two rules which the agency intends to repeal.
To require that in a notice of proposed rule making for a new rule, the notice shall identify two rules which the agency intends to repeal.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Regulatory Reform, Commercial And Antitrust Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Administrative State, Regulatory Reform, and Antitrust

bill.summary: This bill requires federal agencies to include in the notice of a proposed rulemaking for a new rule an identification of two rules that the agency intends to repeal, unless the proposed rule is required by statute.
